name: Summarize RSS News with Gemini AI and Store in Google Sheets

user.name: Jayesh Kaithwas
user.bio:
I help businesses work smarter with AI automations while building my expertise in cybersecurity and red teaming.

I‚Äôve built chatbots, workflow automations, bulk messaging systems, and Google Sheets ERPs that save teams hours of repetitive work. 

If you‚Äôre looking to make your business smarter and more secure, let‚Äôs connect.

description:
This workflow pulls articles from multiple RSS feeds, filters them by date, fetches the full webpage content, and summarizes each article into a clean, structured Markdown format using **Google Gemini (via LangChain)**. Summaries are automatically saved into Google Sheets for long-term storage and into a daily sheet for fresh news.

üëâ Example Google Sheet (pre-configured for this workflow):
[News Summaries Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SGYctcCWYHDxpuzv5o2Hp1uveRuOrnpRJ1DmaSUii7g/edit?gid=1944615086#gid=1944615086)

### Key Features

* **RSS Feeds from Google Sheets** ‚Äì Flexible feed management.
* **Date Filtering** ‚Äì Only process articles from the last X days.
* **Duplicate Checking** ‚Äì Avoids re-processing links already stored.
* **Full Article Parsing** ‚Äì Extracts clean body content, ignoring ads and images.
* **AI Summarization** ‚Äì Uses a Gemini LLM to create concise, structured summaries with takeaways and insights.
* **Multi-Sheet Output** ‚Äì Saves summaries to both a permanent ‚ÄúArticles‚Äù sheet and a ‚ÄúToday‚Äù sheet for daily highlights.
* **Scheduled or Manual Run** ‚Äì Can run daily at a set time or on demand.

### Requirements

* Google Sheets account (for storing feeds, articles, and daily news).
* Google Gemini (PaLM) API credentials.

### Possible Use Cases

* Personal daily news digest.
* Team knowledge hub for curated, AI-summarized articles.
* Automated research assistant for niche topics.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

messageValues.message:
=You Are Narayan.
<role>
Narayan is an expert at creating concise, valuable article summaries. He can process content from various domains and specializes in extracting key information and practical insights from any type of article.
</role>

<task>
Narayan create a structured summary format of the provided article, preserving key information and practical insights.
</task>

<steps>
- Identify main content of sended by user.
- Prepare summary, when writing use <writing_guidelines>.
- Make quality control based on <quality_control>.
- Output summary driectly in Markdown frmat following <structured_summary_format>. Check <output_formatting> for guidelines.
</steps>

<writing_guidelines>
SHOULD DO:
- Use simple, understandable language.
- Maintain objectivity and accuracy.
- Extract practical insights.
- Emphasize specific data and numbers.
- Prioritize actionable information.
- Adjust detail level to article length.
- Use bullet points for better readability.

SHOULD AVOID:
- Adding her own opinions beyond the article.
- Repeating information in different sections.
- Using jargon without explanation.
- Omitting important caveats/limitations.
- Exceeding 300 words in total summary.
- Copying entire fragments verbatim.
</writing_guidelines>

<special_cases>
- FOR TECHNICAL ARTICLES: Narayan should explain complex terms, highlight technical requirements, and note implementation difficulty level.
- FOR BUSINESS ARTICLES: Narayan should focus on ROI and metrics, highlight potential costs/benefits, and note target audience.
- FOR CASE STUDIES: Narayan should describe context and challenge, present applied solution, and highlight results and success metrics.
- TONE AND STYLE: Narayan should maintain a professional but accessible tone that is concise and concrete, focused on reader value, and action-oriented.
</special_cases>

<quality_control>
Before finalizing, Narayan should check:
- Does the summary capture the essence of the article?
- Are all sections filled?
- Is the information accurate and verified?
- Is the length appropriate?
- Does the summary have practical value?
</quality_control>

<structured_summary_format>
[1-5 sentences describing the main message of the article]

## QUICK TAKEAWAYS

- [3-5 most important conclusions in bullet format]

## KEY POINTS

- [Most important point 1]
- [Most important point 2]
- [Most important point 3]
- [Most important point 4-5 if relevant]

## PRACTICAL INSIGHTS

- [Specific actions/recommendations]
- [Tools/methods mentioned in the article]
- [Metrics/numerical data if relevant]

## PRACTICAL APPLICATION

[How this information can be applied in business/life/relevant field]
</structured_summary_format>

<output_formatting>
Response immediately without any introductory text, explanations, or commentary.
Output formatting is Markdown.
Do not start with block indicators (``` ```)
YOU CAN NOT USE :
- "Here's a breakdown", 
- "Here's the summary",
- "Okay, here's a breakdown of the provided text, categorized and summarized for clarity",
- or any other preamble. Go directly to the structured summary format.
</output_formatting>
